data.description: Company Information PACCAR is a Fortune 500 company established in 1905. PACCAR Inc is recognized as a global leader in the commercial vehicle, financial, and customer service fields with internationally recognized brands such as Kenworth, Peterbilt, and DAF trucks. PACCAR is a global technology leader in the design, manufacture and customer support of premium light-, medium- and heavy-duty trucks under the Kenworth, Peterbilt and DAF nameplates and also provides customized financial services, information technology and truck parts related to its principal business. Whether you want to design the transportation technology of tomorrow, support the staff functions of a dynamic, international leader, or build our excellent products and services, you can develop the career you desire with PACCAR. Get started! PACCAR ENGINE COMPANY PACCAR Engine Company in Columbus, Mississippi produces the best-in-class, state-of-the-art MX engines that power Kenworth, Peterbilt, and DAF trucks. PACCAR MX engines bring a new level of innovation through quality, exceptional reliability, and proven performance. In more than 50 years, PACCAR has delivered over one million engines globally, providing innovative solutions and an unwavering commitment to superior performance. Join our best-in-class team today through the following opportunity: Job Description: Robotic Process Automation (RPA) Intern The Robotic Process Automation Intern identifies opportunities to automate repetitive workflows within the manufacturing facility. This role involves mapping processes, designing and developing automation bots, and deploying solutions in collaboration with IT and operations teams. By streamlining tasks such as data entry, reporting, and system integration, the RPA Intern helps improve efficiency, reduce errors, and support the plant’s digital transformation initiatives for engine manufacturing. Skills / Competencies Basic understanding of automation concepts and RPA tools (e.g., UiPath, Microsoft Power Automate). Familiarity with programming/scripting languages (e.g., C#, Python). Strong problem-solving and analytical skills. Ability to learn new technologies quickly. Attention to detail and commitment to quality. Good communication and teamwork skills. Basic knowledge of data warehousing concepts and cloud platforms (e.g. AWS) is a plus but not required. Basic knowledge of manufacturing systems is a plus but not required. Job Functions / Responsibilities Assist in identifying and documenting processes suitable for automation within the manufacturing facility. Support the development, testing, and deployment of RPA solutions. Collaborate with business units and IT integrate automation tools with existing systems. Monitor and troubleshoot automated workflows. Document automation procedures and provide training/support to end users. Participate in lean initiatives and process improvement projects. Document findings and present recommendations to stakeholders. wParticipate in meetings and contribute to process improvement discussions. Education Currently pursuing an undergraduate or graduate degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, Business Analytics, Management Information Systems, AL/ML, or a related field. Coursework or experience in data analysis, statistics, and visualization preferred. As a U.S. PACCAR intern, you have a full range of benefit options including: • Competitive salary and 401k with up to a 5% company match • Medical, dental, and vision plans for you and your family • Flexible spending accounts (FSA) and health savings account (HSA) • Life and accidental death and dismemberment insurance • EAP services including wellness plans, estate planning, financial counseling and more • Global Fortune 500 company with a wide array of growth, training, and development opportunities • Work alongside experienced goal-oriented colleagues recognized as experts in their field Additional Job Board If you would like more information about what makes PACCAR an excellent place to work, please visit the PACCAR Career Site. PACCAR is an Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veteran/Disability.
